intro: Pentacalia carupana, commonly known as the Carupana pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. The flowers are often pale blue or white, and they bloom during the spring and summer months.
